choices: Jackson finds a strange piece of jewelry on the sidewalk and decides to take it.
Rob introduces him to a strange new drug on the way to school.
A suspicious black car pulls up to him to ask for directions.
His homeroom teacher is a witch and decides to teach him a lesson for something.
Something in his DNA awakens and starts to change him slowly.
1.content:
Jackson was your average looking 17 year old kid. Messy brown hair, cruddy clothes he thought looked cool. All in all he was a pretty generic looking guy, easily blending in in a big crowd.

We find our young hero making his way down the sidewalk to meet up with his friend Rob on the way to school. First day of their last year there. Jackson couldn't be happier.

Little did he know that his school year was about to get a bit out of the ordinary...

(How does it begin?)
1.title: It Begins...

choices: A pendant with the image of an angelic maiden
A ring with Latin phrases inscribed inside it
An anklet decorated with strange gemstones
11.content:
Jackson and Rob walked down Main Street, past the antique shop that Rob's grandma owned. They greeted her by the front door and Rob asked her what new wares she'd received over the weekend. While they talked, Jackson stuck his hands inside the tiny pockets of his hoodie, which he'd been wearing since eighth grade, and watched the morning traffic chug along between orange cones and construction trucks blocking off turn lanes. The sky was smog grey and every building looked slightly dilapidated. "What a shitty town," he thought.

He started fantasizing about Alyssa Carnahan. Alyssa Carnahan from last year's Physics, with her enchanting dark brown, almost black, hair parted from her forehead to show eyebrows Da Vinci would have been proud to trace; eyes Jackson imagined as blue, because he never got close enough to see their true color; a slim, dancer's figure that advertised little, but suggested so much; Alyssa who was currently single, or so the gossip went, and who had posted a Facebook status last night that read: "Final year! Wow!! I can't believe it's been 4 years! I'm looking forward to all the great times and new people and graduation. Live big cuz you don't know what's gonna happen. ;)"

Jackson took that as a sign. He liked her status, along with ninety-eight other people, and spent the whole night and most of that morning imagining how to distinguish himself from the pack.

He woke up to a pair of fingers snapping in his face.

"Hey! Earth to daydreamer!" Rob lightly slapped Jackson's cheek. "You're wanted at Garfield High School."

"What the fuck?" Jackson snapped. Thankfully, Rob's grandma had unlocked the door and slipped through it before she could hear him. They continued walking. "We've got twenty minutes. Chill the fuck out."

"You don't expect you'll get Alyssa, talking language like that," Rob said, grinning.

Jackson glared. "How do you know I want Alyssa?"

Rob scoffed. "Dude! That's all you've been talking about since sophomore year! Come on, man, you've got, like, two weeks to ask her out before some cute choir guy has her taken. And that's an optimistic estimate."

"Yeah, yeah, Mr. Writer," Jackson grumbled. "I'm just thinking about it, okay? No commitments. I'll see who's in my classes, and - you never know - could be someone cuter."

"I doubt it," said Rob, with a shrug. He adjusted the strap on his brown leather satchel - his substitute for a backpack - and wiped the dirty-blonde hair away from his eyes before sighing: "I get you, though. I've been trying to win back Melanie all summer, but she's not biting. You've got to do something special, whether it's flowers or jewelry or standing outside their window with a boombox over your head. You can't just beg them."

He caught Jackson staring at him blankly. "Boombox?" Jackson said.

"That's OK," muttered Rob. "You wouldn't know it."

They arrived at school five minutes before the first-period bell. Three empty school buses idled at the curb, and a few other stragglers were scurrying up the front steps. Rob said, "Race you to the door," but just as he started running something slipped from his satchel and clattered on the sidewalk. It shone blindingly in the sunlight.

"Hold a tick!" Jackson yelled. He stooped down and gently lifted the shining, metal object, trying to make it out through the glare...

Jackson bent down and picked up what he saw. He picked up a small pendant. The image on it was of an angelic maiden.

Jackson took the pendant and...

And now exactly this is going to change:
His messy brown hair became more silky and shining: Not only his body changed, but before the more dramatic changes will start his cruddy clothes, meaning his strange red t-shirt with a bear on it was replaced by something more fashionable, but girls fashion, meaning a nice blouse….His baggy jeans became more elegant jeans…

In shock about that the next shock arrived as his penis started to burn in pain and disappearing….

choices: Give it to Alyssa sometime today.
Wait and think about it some more.
113.content:
Jackson held the bejeweled item in front of him for a few moments, looking it over. He'd never held anything so sparkly - nothing that looked so valuable, anyway. It was a small thin golden chain, about the size of a bracelet. In fact, Jackson assumed it was such. "Hey, Rob, you dropped something..."

Rob retreated back down the steps to Jackson. "What? Oh, whoops! That probably shouldn't have fallen out. It was from my grandma. She wanted me to have it, god knows why. She said it "suited" me, that it came in individually without any ID, so she can't sell it online. She has trouble selling anklets in-store."

"Oh, so this is an anklet?"

Rob smiled. "Yeah, that's what I said. That's what Granny said too, but you know she might've just said that to "spice it up" a bit. It's probably just another cheap knock-off Zales piece that some distributor tried to unload onto her. She's tried to give those to my mom before, and when she tried to resell it, the pawnbroker gave her ten bucks. This one's kind of gawdy with all those jewels."

Jackson tapped the gems: there were about nine of them, each the size of his thumb nail, linked onto the chain by a couple small golden rings. They were each a different color, rich and iridescent in ways that made Jackson question the supposedly "cheap" value that Rob declared. The jewels dangled off the piece in such a way that, if worn, they would bounce and swing with every movement made.

Rob sighed and poked Jackson's forehead. "Come on, buddy. The bell's gonna ring in like two minutes. We've got to get ske-daddlin'." Then he added: "Look, if you like the bauble so much, it's yours."

Jackson furrowed his eyebrows. "No, dude I don't want it. What am I gonna do with an anklet?"

Rob smirked and raised his own eyebrows. "Why, I figured you'd give it to a girl. Maybe someone who could really make those glittery things shake?" He reached forward and flipped one of the gems with his finger.

Before Jackson could argue, Rob gave him a salute and ran up the stairs, his satchel flapping against his side as he sprinted. Jackson stuffed the jewel into a zippered pocket on the side of his backpack.

As he slid into the door of his English class on the last chime of the 7:30 bell, he noticed Alyssa sitting on the other side of the classroom. His heart applauded when he realized she was in his class. Then his abdomen started to knot when he saw three other guys all sitting around her. Sure, one of them was gay and another was a jock - he figured she wasn't really into the hey-wanna-be-my-cheerleader scene. But the third guy, the one sitting in the front row, the seat right before hers, was Nick Addams. And if the girl you liked liked Nick Addams, well, you might as well just roll over and present your soft belly in surrender. He was the name at the top of every list at Garfield High. Best dressed, best sense of humor, best smile, 36 ACT score, best singing voice, first place at State his junior year for the 100 meter dash in Track & Field...the list went on.

Jackson sat down at the nearest open desk and pulled out a notebook. While the teacher, Ms. Lemmon, dispersed the syllabus to everyone (while simultaneously dispensing apologies for killing trees), Jackson's thoughts traveled back to the piece of jewelry in his bag. Heart pounding, he weighed his options...

If I give this anklet to Alyssa, maybe she'll wear it when she dances. Maybe this is the thing I need to make me distinct from all the other guys like Nick. Or maybe she'll think it's creepy and I'll ruin all my chances with her, all because I listened to fucking Rob.

He twirled his pen as he decided, If I do give it to Alyssa, I need to do it right away. I need to get rid of this thing today before someone else asks her out. Then, with a sharp exhale, he thought, I should try and start senior year off right. And save myself from having a heart attack.
113.title: An anklet decorated with strange gemstones

choices: They hear a voice from inside the tiara
114.content:
“What’s that?” asked Rob.

“It looks like… half a crown.”

Jackson showed it to Rob. “That’s a tiara,” said Rob. He took it in his hands and turned it over. “A very ugly one,” he added. It looked to be made of copper, now dull and rusted, with three prongs projecting from the forehead that had been chipped away until they were almost flatheaded. Nothing else distinguished it, no gemstones or baroque engravings. “This was in my bag?”

Jackson nodded. “I saw it fall out.”

Rob pursed his lips. “I don’t know how it could have fit in there…”

“Maybe your grandma gave it to you. She slipped it in there. I don’t know.” Jackson shrugged. “’Have a good first day of school.’ Something to surprise you.”

“Well, it’s a shitty surprise.”
114.title: A plain, unattractive tiara

choices: Rob puts it on Jackson's head
Rob puts it on his own head
Rob suggests they give it to someone else
1141.content:
Rob and Jackson continued to examine it. “Maybe it slipped in by accident?” suggested Jackson.

“Maybe,” said Rob, “but I didn’t see anything in her hands…”

“She say anything unusual?”

“You know my grandma. She’s always prattling about conspiracies. How the Mayans predicted Pearl Harbor. Silly stuff.”

Rob trailed off. “Although…”

“What is it?” Jackson leaned in.

“Nothing!” Rob laughed. “Just something about a season of change. Obviously. Fall, last year of school. She didn’t say anything meaningful.”

He twirled the tiara around his fingers. By now, the buses had started to pull away from the curb, and the sidewalks were nearly empty. Jackson wondered what the hell they were spending so much time fixating on a stupid crown-tiara for.
1141.title: They continue examining it

choices: Jackson is transformed by the tiara
Jackson is transformed into the tiara
11411.content:
Just then, Rob got a big, Cheshire grin on his face.

“What?” asked Jackson.

“I think you’ve got your in with Alyssa…”

“Huh?”

Rob presented the tiara to Jackson with a dramatic flare. “Don’t you think she’d love to wear this on the stage? Star of the spring musical, guaranteed prom queen, with a tiara from Burger King. She couldn’t resist you!”

“Cut it out!” Jackson knocked his hand back. “That’s not funny!”

“Oh, but it’s perfect,” said Rob. “Especially if you have it on your head when you see her.”

At ‘head’, Rob moved crabwise before Jackson could grab him, using the speed he’d mastered in cross country to catch Jackson from behind and delicately drop the tiara on his head, all before Jackson knew what had happened.

“What the fuck?” Jackson clawed at his head and tried to pry the tiara off, but he found it glued firmly to his forehead. “It’s stuck—” he said, before the pain cut him off, as the tiara dug into his scalp and emitted a shimmering dark glow…
11411.title: Rob puts it on Jackson's head

choices: Rob goes to his grandma's store at lunchtime.
Rob tries to take matters into his own hands and puts on the tiara.
114112.content:
Rob's smile vanished as he watched his best friend freeze in place before him, engulfed by a black shade that clung to his skin, and made him disappear. It took Rob a full two minutes and the subsequent ringing of the 7:30 bell to bring him back to a sort of consciousness.

"J...Jackson...?" he stammered. But his friend was gone. His clothes and backpack were all that were left behind.

If Rob were a skeptic, he might try and reason with himself that Jackson was just out there in the world, hiding somewhere from him, giggling and naked. And yet, somehow that seemed even less plausible than what had just happened before him.

Nobody else was around to see this happen. Rob sort of crumpled onto the ground, too shocked to cry or yell, and just stared at the tiara. It had now changed from an antique, rusty-copper color to one of solid black. The once-empty prongs were now host to three deep purple gems of variable size. They seemed to glow, even in the absence of sunlight on this cloudy day.

Unsure of what to do, Rob figured he'd take it to his grandma at lunchtime and see if she could explain what just happened. In the meantime, he used the end of his jacket sleeve to pick up the tiara and put it delicately into his bag. He walked inside and went straight for gym, now five minutes late, and tried his best to focus on remembering his locker combination.
114112.title: Jackson is transformed into the tiara

choices: JK! Rob takes Jackson to Alyssa on Jackson's behalf.
Rob puts on the tiara, for real.
1141122.content:
Meanwhile, Jackson was not hurt in any way. In fact, he was feeling pretty good. He wasn't hungry or sleepy, so far as he could tell. He opened his eyes, but did not feel eyelids.

What he saw were pencils. And the edges of folders. A can of Monster, a cell phone, and a couple dollars wadded up behind the pencils. He deduced from his surroundings and from the cell phone that he was inside of Rob's bag, even with just the small shaft of light pouring in from where the zippers above parted.

What. The. Fuck.

He didn't feel his arms. No legs. No hair, no hands. No mouth. No dick. Nothing. He experienced a mild panic attack and found himself breathing uncontrollably fast despite the apparent absence of lungs, and even started to mutter words of disbelief to himself without feeling his lips part.

That's when he suddenly remembered the tiara. And how the more he thought about the small crown, the more the item's shape began to align with his current perception of self.

"Oh my god that fucking crown. I'm the fucking crown," he said. His voice felt echoey, like it was just in his head. Or maybe it was echoing off the books, he couldn't really tell.

As he tried to come to grips with himself as a girl's tiara, and how his opportunity to give said tiara to Alyssa might now be forever lost, the bag became flooded with light as a loud zipping noise erupted from above. Jackson felt himself jostled as two large hands reached in and felt around for him. When the fingers pressed against his metal arms, he winced. He was surprisingly sensitive for a piece of metal.

The hands removed him slowly from the depths of the bag. Jackson found himself staring back at himself from a mirror. Rob was standing before the sink in the private bathroom near the attendance office, the one for handicapped students or families or genderqueer individuals.

"This is for you, buddy. I will sacrifice myself to free you," Rob was saying aloud to himself. "Oh Rob, you fucking dramatic bastard...this is all your fault," Jackson groaned. Before he could expand on his bitterness, Rob lifted Jackson into the air and slowly lowered it onto his head. Jackson started to panic again.

"No! Rob, you idiot! You might trap us both! Stop! Go talk to your grandma!"

Just as Jackson's metal arms grazed Rob's hair, Rob heard his friend's cries. "What? Jackson?! Is that you?!"

"Yes! Now take me off your head and take me to your grandma's!"

As Rob started to shed tears of joy, he also found himself laughing.

"What?!" Jackson exclaimed. Rob held his metallic friend up to his ear.

"Well, I'm glad to know you're alive and all...I just never thought I'd ever hear you ask me to do that."

"Me neither," Jackson sighed.

Rob looked at his best friend, who was now a black tiara, and shook his head. "Oh buddy, look at you. Living the life of a crown. You'll grace the heads of ballerinas, sit behind glass in private museums, or be featured in some off-Broadway show about the Romanovs. It'll be great. No college, no minimum wage jobs, just sixteen-year-old's birthdays and proms year-round..."

Jackson felt his phantom heart pound. "Rob, please cut the bullshit and just take me to your grandma's, seriously."

"I will...or I could give you the experience of a lifetime."

"What?"

"I could give you to Alyssa."

"WHAT?!"

"Yeah, just think! Maybe you'll just sit on her bedroom dresser, watching her change every day. Or maybe this fancy tiara will suck her up too, and you'll both be in there together. Or who knows! The possibilities are endless!"

These ideas did give Jackson pause. In fact, they seemed to give Rob pause too. Maybe it was a consequence of holding the enchanted tiara for too long, or maybe he was just a bigger horndog than Jackson gave him credit for, but Rob's gaze at his friend suddenly shifted from happy to hungry.

"In fact...what if I could become the tiara, and then you gave me to Alyssa? Then you'd win the girl over, and I'd get to watch her change every day! Yeah, that works too."

"WAIT!"

But it was too late. Rob was already lifting Jackson onto his head again.

13.content:
The walk to school up to that point had been pretty uneventful. Rob said something, Jackson said something back, etc. But then they stopped at a corner, waiting for busy traffic to pass, and Rob said something quite out of the ordinary.

"Dude, listen: I couldn't say anything before, but I think somebody's following us."

Jackson tried to turn around, but his friend grabbed his head before it could go too far. In that split second, Jackson did spy something like a shiny black limousine behind them.

"That limo, has it always been there?"

"Yeah, I just started hearing the tires once we got onto that really gravelly road. I think it's safe to say that neither one of us recognizes it."

They were almost to school. There would be help there. Jackson and Rob tried to forge onward, but the mysterious black car suddenly jumped in front of them when they got to the next block.

A middle-aged woman in sunglasses lowered the rear window.

"Good morning, boys. My chauffeur has just gotten us hopelessly lost, and we were just wondering how to get onto Sycamore from here." she said in a near-complete monotone. The boys both knew that something was up, but they silently decided to play along for as long as they could.

"Sycamore?" Rob said, cocking his head to one side. "We're nowhere near Sycamore."

"Yes, he is very lost."

Unfortunately for them, their focus had left them vulnerable to attacks from behind. A sudden blow to the back of the skull brought Rob down, sinking face forward onto the ground. Jackson cried out, but the massive, dark-suited man who had delivered the blow had him by the neck in a trice. The boy felt a sudden pressure on his carotid artery. Things began to darken and spin. All the fight seemed to leave his body.

The man bundled him into the back seat of the limo along with the woman and they drove off. A few strips of duct tape were then expertly placed to bind his arms and ankles.

Perhaps he will learn something more on the way to the obviously-bad guys' hideout, but what?
13.title: A suspicious black car pulls up

14.content:
As Rob and Jackson walked into their homeroom class that morning, Jackson found himself colliding with something soft while he wasn't looking. He found himself with his face stuffed into buxom bosom of the new teacher, Ms. Morose. She was a tall, curvaceous woman with long, raven hair and piercing eyes.

Jackson quickly apologized, to which the teacher smiled. "It's alright, it was an accident. Now please, take your assigned seats."

As Jackson and Rob searched for their seats, Jackson made a brief comment on the side as a joke. "Man, babes like her must have it easy!"

Little did they know that she heard Jackson's statement from the front of the room, and it made a downright wicked thought pop into her head. She made her way to her desk, pulling out a magic wand she kept with her at all times, and pointed it in his direction from under the desk. Then she thought up her spell.

This boy will become like the next female to enter the room, and only he and I will notice as he slowly changes.

Suddenly, into the room walked...

... Angela Vikstrom, a second-year student who was also member of the junior-varsity cheerleading squad. She lacked the grace and intensity of the varsity cheerleaders, but she was still very talented, almost six-feet tall and well-built, with firm thighs and a tight abdomen that peeked out from under her form-fitting, maroon tank top. She saw Rob and waved eagerly. His cheeks turned red and he waved back, before immediately averting his eyes. He heard Ms. Morose's voice echo inside of his head. You and Angela will become very close this year... One might say you'll be fighting for the same team.

Jackson saw Ms. Morose standing behind her desk, pointing a short, white stick at him. She was smiling. Jackson tried to yell something at her, but his mouth was sealed shut. A second later, the world turned to black, and his mind went blank. The last thing he heard was Morose speaking to him:

We'll see how easy it is, being the most envied babe in the school...

Jackson received a text.

"I'll be getting in late again. Supper's in the fridge."

Jackson groaned. The woman he called "mom" was always working late at the office. She never really seemed interested in anything other than her job. His "dad" did his best to pick up the slack, but for some reason, he's felt a distance to both of them when he finally overheard them mention he was adopted late one night a few months ago, made worse by the fact that his mother saying she never really wanted him.

"Great, more hot dogs." Jackson grumbled, before sighing.

Back at Jackson's house he has retrieved the hot dog's from the fridge and is about to eat them with his hands when he suddenly stops. "I'm not some animal," he says to himself, "I can eat this like a civilized human being." Jackson then goes to the cabinets and retrieves a plate to place them on. He then goes to the draws to retrieve a knife and fork as well as a napkin. Once he's set the table he sits down to eat. For the course of the meal he carefully cuts his meal into bite sized pieces before taking time to chew them carefully. Taking his time with each and every bite to ensure it would digest properly before swallowing. His posture remains straight, elbows off the table at all times, he even takes the effort to carefully hide any release of gas he produced.
         Once he finally finished his meal he carefully clean his mouth with the napkin, takes the empty plate and silver wear to the sink and soaks them in water before throwing away the napkin. As he was walking to the bathroom to clean up for bed he stops. He then turns around and looks back at the kitchen as if it was foreign to him. Thinking back at how he had eaten his meal it felt foreign to him. Never had he eaten hotdogs with a knife and fork, and certainly never once in his life taken the time to "properly" chew his food. He quickly shakes his head and chalks it up to merely being drowsy. He quickly brushes his teeth and flops down on his bed hopping tomorrow would be less strange. info.brief_description: A young man in his last year of high school experiences some weird changes in his life.
info.description:
Jackson, for whatever reason, is going through some weird changes and events on the first day of his senior year of high school.

Rules:
- Do not use something else as an option. If you cannot think of branching paths, then rethink your idea.
- No ending the story.
- Keep your posts long and detailed, at least a paragraph long.
- No linking to pictures. If you cannot describe the change, then you shouldn't be writing.
- While changes can happen to other people around him, Jackson must be involved in some way. (E.G., he touches them, he thinks something about them, etc.) He will always be the center of attention.

Fetishes Allowed:
- TG (Gender changes. M2F, F2H, or M2H only please.)
- TF (Transformations. Any kind as long as it does not conflict with other rules)
- Age Progression (No old people)
- Breast/Butt/Hourglass expansion
- Growth (Height or muscle)
- Giantess (No giant guys.)
- Hypnosis/Brainwashing/Mind Control
- Reality Change (No one notices change.)
- Incest
- Anthro
- Futa/Herm

NOT ALLOWED:
- Scat
- Watersports
- Bestiality
- Foot fetish
- Guy on guy yaoi
- Shrinking
- Crushing/snuff
- Torture/guro
- F2M gender change

Have fun!
